title: Mojojojo: The indie music scene is too small to focus on political matters
text:
Mojojojo started off as a bassist with bands like Paradigm Shift and Barefaced Liar, but feels bass playing is much maligned.
READ: With 'Shots Fired' musician MojoJojo announces arrival
"Bass players are considered to be the runt of the band. From an aesthetic and a popularity perspective, I figured that much after learning bass. The reason I picked it up was because the bass guitar as an instrument handles the rhythm as well as the melody. There's a saying that bass is the mother of the band and the drum set is the father. All the prolific songwriters and singers are primarily bass players - Sting, Steve Harris from Iron Maiden and John Paul Jones from Led Zeppelin," he says.

His latest album Shots Fired is a bass-rich electronica album which fuses some Indian elements. Says he, "The track ' Thar Bomb' features Rajasthani folk chanting by villagers having Panchayat sessions. I didn't intend to record music on this trip, but came back with many. Bringing Indianness to music is very important because that's where our identity lies."

As for the current state of indie music, he says, "I love that there are a lot of people in the music scene who are extremely collaborative and have a community approach towards music. There are too many camps right now about the kind of music people make. I feel the music scene is too small to focus on these political matters because the country is huge and it is opening up to so many opportunities, with so many festivals coming in.
If we are a little more open minded, the sky is the limit. The music scene can literally accommodate everybody. We should help each other out and that's what I have tried with my collaborations."
